subject: Re: [junit] JUNIT :How to make it Data Driven
msgSnippet: Pratush, You may want to look at the Parameterized test runner for JUnit 4.  Even in that case, you d need to write your own driver for reading and writing the
messageBody:
Pratush,

You may want to look at the Parameterized test runner for JUnit 4. Even
in that case, you'd need to write your own driver for reading and
writing the Excel.

You could also look at FIT, which uses HTML tables.

If you're committed to using Excel, your first order of business is
probably making sure you know how to interface between Excel and Java,
before worrying at all about JUnit. Good luck,

David Saff

Pratush Dayal wrote:
>
> Hi,
> I recently have started working on in JUNIT.I have few doubts for Data
> Driven Test Cases. The scenario is as follows
>
> 1) I am passing the Input value (as of now I have hardcoded the value in
> my function) to a function that calculates the output and returns the
> result.
>
> 2) After result is received, I am comparing the final output with other
> hardcoded value.
>
>
> Doubt:
>
> How can I pass input values from excel sheet.
> How can I store the result back to the excel sheet
> how can I read or write the excel sheet.
>
> Snippet of Code:
>
> testItem i =new
> testItem();
>
> i.setDistributionMethod("DEFAULT");
> i.setSku("pdayal9100");
> i.setName("test
> Upgrade");
> i.setUnitPrice(1000.0);
> i.setQuantity(1);
> i.setUnitShipCost(5);
>
>
> For all these hardcoded values for e.g. setSKU or setQuantity I want to
> pick from excel sheet and store the result in the same excel sheet.
>
>
> Kindly help me in this regard....
>
> Pratush Dayal
>
>
>
>
>
>
